physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initially admitted with acute respiratory distress syndrome; improvement in oxygen fraction ratio from 107 to 369, and PaCO2 from 45.9 mmHg to 41.6 mmHg noted during treatment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Respiratory failure steadily improved for 20 days, deteriorated after discontinuation of methylprednisolone on day 29, improved again with resumption of methylprednisolone. Follow-up on day 51 showed vaseline oil concentration decreased to 4 mg/ml, and gas exchange and respiratory function improved post-lavage.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Lung weight: 2,101 g; excess tissue mass: 1,311.26 g (261.18%); normally aerated fraction: 5%; respiratory compliance: 60 ml/cm H2O.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Whole-lung CT scan showed persistent diffuse ground-glass opacification, particularly marked in lower lobes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No significant changes in lung oil concentration compared to day 1 CT scan results despite treatment.
